list_definition.definition: to clean (a room etc) using a brush or broom

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The room has been swept clean.

list_definition.definition: to move as though with a brush

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She swept the crumbs off the table with her hand
Don’t get swept away by (= become over-enthusiastic about) the idea!

list_definition.mean_english: lan ra, di chuyển nhanh trên một vùng

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The disease/craze is sweeping the country.

list_definition.definition: to move swiftly or in a proud manner

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: High winds sweep across the desert
She swept into my room without knocking on the door.

list_definition.definition: an act of sweeping, or process of being swept, with a brush etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She gave the room a sweep.
He indicated the damage with a sweep of his hand.

list_definition.mean_english: lối đánh cá ngựa được vơ cả
